senses.de: A sleeveless garment worn on the upper body, usually over a shirt.
senses.ex: He wore a vest over his white shirt to the wedding.

Tips.title: Formal Attire
Tips.description: Vests are often part of formal wear, combined with suits and ties.
Tips.example: He donned his vest for the formal gala.

Tips.title: Layering Piece
Tips.description: A vest acts as a middle layer between a shirt and a suit jacket.
Tips.example: She chose a silk vest to layer her business attire.

Tips.title: Casual Options
Tips.description: Informal vests, like vest tops, are worn for casual occasions.
Tips.example: On a hot day, he opted for a lightweight vest top.

senses.de: A protective outer garment, like a bulletproof vest or life vest.
senses.ex: The police officer put on a bulletproof vest for safety.

Tips.title: Safety First
Tips.description: Safety vests are high-visibility clothing for protection.
Tips.example: Construction workers wear orange safety vests at the site.

Tips.title: Specialized Use
Tips.description: Some vests serve specific purposes, like flotation or bullet resistance.
Tips.example: Life vests are essential for safety on a boat.

senses.de: To give someone power or legal authority, especially in a formal wayã€‚
senses.ex: The powers are vested in the board of directors.

Tips.title: Legal Authority
Tips.description: In law, 'vest' can mean to legally grant power or rights.
Tips.example: Responsibility vested in her at the company's inception.

Tips.title: Process Over Time
Tips.description: Some rights or powers vest over time according to specific conditions or laws.
Tips.example: The shares will vest over a five-year period.

senses.de: To give someone the legal right to own a property or asset
senses.ex: The property will vest in the children when they turn 18.

Tips.title: Ownership Transfer
Tips.description: To vest property means to transfer ownership, often triggered by an event.
Tips.example: The land vested in him after his father's passing.

Bodice.wordDefinition:
A bodice and a vest are both pieces of clothing worn on the upper body, but they are different in their design and purpose.

A bodice is a fitted garment that usually extends from the shoulders to the waist or hips, hugging the torso and accentuating the curves of the body.

The bodice provides support and structure to the bust and waistline, making the wearer look more elegant and feminine.

A bodice is a form-fitting and often glamorous top for women, while a vest is a sleeveless and versatile layer for men and women.

Camisole.wordDefinition:
A camisole and a vest are both types of sleeveless garments worn as an underlayer but they have some differences in their design and purpose.

A camisole is a form-fitting, lightweight top that usually has spaghetti straps or thin shoulder straps. It is meant to be worn as an undergarment, usually under a shirt or a blouse, to provide coverage and add an extra layer for warmth.

Camisoles can also be worn alone as a tank top or a lounge-wear.

A vest is a sleeveless garment that is often made of thicker material than a camisole. It usually has a more relaxed fit and may have buttons, zippers, or pockets.

A camisole is a more form-fitting and lightweight undergarment while a vest is a more substantial outerwear garment.

Corset.wordDefinition:
A corset is a tight-fitting undergarment that is worn to cinch in the waist and give the wearer an hourglass figure.

It is typically made of strong material and has boning to keep its shape. Corsets are usually associated with historical clothing or lingerie.

A corset is a tight-fitting undergarment used to shape the figure, while a vest is a sleeveless garment worn over a shirt or blouse.

Jerkin.wordDefinition:
A jerkin is a sleeveless, close-fitting jacket or vest that is traditionally made of leather or suede.

Jerkins are more commonly worn as a part of historical or costume dressing, as they were popular in the medieval times.

Undershirt.wordDefinition:
Undershirt and vest are two different types of clothing worn underneath a shirt or a jacket.

An undershirt, also known as a t-shirt, is a thin and lightweight garment worn underneath a shirt to absorb sweat and provide a layer of comfort.

An undershirt is a thin cotton garment worn directly over the skin to absorb sweat and provide a layer of comfort.

Waistcoat.wordDefinition:
A vest and a waistcoat are both types of clothing that are worn over a shirt, but there are some differences between them.

A waistcoat is a more formal piece of clothing.

A waistcoat typically has two pockets on the front and is often worn as part of a three-piece suit.

While a vest can be worn in more casual settings, a waistcoat is typically reserved for formal occasions.

To sum it up, a vest is a sleeveless garment that is worn as an undergarment or as a layering piece, while a waistcoat is a more formal garment that is part of a suit and is worn for formal occasions.

quotes.Text: Most of the people around me have a vested interest in how much money I make. You know, so a celebrity could find themselves in a position where people could have meetings about their life without them involved. And when I say 'their life' I mean not their professional life either. They could talk about their personal life.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Dave Chappelle

quotes.Text: I get vested in my guys. I want to know who their family members are, I want to know their interests, I want to know what makes them tick. I want them to also know I care about the other side of them, their personal character and growth as men, because I think we all sharpen each other that way.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Monty Williams

quotes.Text: When you love somebody, and they go through a real adversity, you don't back away from that relationship. You don't say, 'When you're better, call me.' The opposite happens. Your bond strengthens, and you become even more vested.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Rocky Carroll

quotes.Text: I don't have a vested interest in a particular political career or a particular political office. My job is to do everything that I can to create an America and a world that we can live in and that we can survive in.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jill Stein

quotes.Text: It has been said that the position of woman is the test of civilization, and that of our women was secure. In them was vested our standard of morals and the purity of our blood.
quotes.Title: Sioux Author
quotes.Name: Charles Eastman

quotes.Text: I think it is important that you care about the characters, and you are not just waiting for the next action sequence but have a vested interested in what happens to them.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actor
quotes.Name: Shawn Ashmore

quotes.Text: I've always supported LGBT organizations and things like that because I felt like I had a vested interest in this, where I wanted to help out.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin McHale

quotes.Text: The state and its leaders have not only a responsibility but also a vested interest in defending the sacredness and value of every human life.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Blase J. Cupich

quotes.Text: I have never worn a sweater vest a day in my life. Nor will I ever wear a sweater vest.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Josie Totah

quotes.Text: Everyone should help women. Everyone has a vested interest.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Patricia Arquette
